subject: May 23, 2007
body:
CNN.com Student News Newsletter






 
Wednesday, May 23, 2007



 Watch and Learn 
Today's edition of CNN Student News begins with a report on a 12-year-old war casualty who remains determined to succeed. Then, we check out some predictions for the 2007 Atlantic hurricane season. And we find out why New York's yellow cabs are set to go green.

 Colleges deal with items left behind by students 
College students have more possessions than ever, and in the frenzy of finals, commencement and last-gasp partying before the end of the school year, little time is left for an orderly move. Purging is often easier than shipping or storing.


 
CNN Student News is a 10-minute, commercial-free news program that airs on CNN Headline News at 3:12 a.m. EST as well as on CNN.com/EDUCATION. Created by a team of journalists and educators, the program provides the top stories of the day, segments that encourage student participation, and in-depth special reports. In addition, CNN Student News provides free curriculum at CNN.com/EDUCATION to accompany each program's content. CNN Student News, along with CNN Presents: Classroom Edition, is Turner Broadcasting's contribution to Cable in the Classroom.
